skill.name: mathjax-rendering
skill.description: Render mathematical formulas in Obsidian using LaTeX/MathJax syntax. Use when writing equations, matrices, integrals, summations, or any mathematical notation in Obsidian notes.
skill.summary: Render mathematical formulas in Obsidian using LaTeX/MathJax syntax. Use when writing equations, mat...
skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing reference materials for LaTeX/MathJax syntax. No executable code, no file access, no network operations, and no command execution. Pure educational content that matches its stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Obsidian uses MathJax to render mathematical notation but the LaTeX syntax is difficult to remember. This skill provides quick reference tables for fractions, matrices, integrals, Greek letters, and all common math symbols so you can write professional equations in your notes.
actual_capabilities: Write inline and block math equations using LaTeX syntax
Create matrices with various bracket styles (pmatrix, bmatrix, vmatrix)
Use Greek letters and mathematical symbols in formulas
Format integrals, sums, limits, and derivatives correctly
Apply decorations like hats, bars, vectors, and overbraces
Align multi-line equations and create conditional definitions
limitations: Does not execute or verify LaTeX code - provides reference only
Does not generate rendered images or preview output
Limited to MathJax-supported LaTeX subset supported by Obsidian
No troubleshooting or error correction for malformed equations

use_cases.title: Create Math Notes
use_cases.description: Write lecture notes with properly formatted equations for calculus, linear algebra, and statistics.

use_cases.title: Document Formulas
use_cases.description: Include complex mathematical notation in research documentation and technical papers within Obsidian.

use_cases.title: Build Math Content
use_cases.description: Create educational materials with clear mathematical expressions and step-by-step derivations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Equation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an inline equation showing the quadratic formula $x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}$

prompt_templates.title: Matrix Display
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a 3x3 identity matrix using bmatrix environment with proper syntax

prompt_templates.title: Calculus Notation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a definite integral from 0 to infinity with proper spacing: $\int_0^\infty e^{-x^2} dx$

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Line Proof
prompt_templates.prompt: Demonstrate the binomial expansion using aligned environment with proper alignment points

output_examples.input: Show me how to write a fraction, square root, and Greek letter in math mode

best_practices: Use `$...$` for inline equations and `$$...$$` for display equations
Wrap multi-character exponents and subscripts in braces like `x^{2n}`
Use `\left(` and `\right)` for auto-sizing delimiters around fractions
Insert `\,` before `dx` for proper spacing in integrals
anti_patterns: Forgetting to escape special characters outside math mode can break rendering
Using `[` and `]` without proper escaping in Markdown can cause syntax errors
Missing braces around multi-character subscripts like `x_ij` instead of `x_{ij}`
Using `|` for absolute values without proper sizing can look incorrect

faq.question: Does this work with Obsidian mobile apps?
faq.answer: Yes. Obsidian mobile fully supports MathJax rendering with the same LaTeX syntax as the desktop version.

faq.question: What LaTeX packages are supported?
faq.answer: Obsidian supports a subset of LaTeX including amsmath, amsfonts, andcancel. Check Obsidian help for full list.

faq.question: Can I number equations automatically?
faq.answer: Use the `equation` environment for numbered equations or `equation*` for unnumbered display math.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill is read-only documentation. It does not access, modify, or transmit any of your Obsidian vault data.

faq.question: Why do my equations not render?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing dollar signs, unescaped characters, unclosed braces, or using unsupported LaTeX commands.

faq.question: How is this different from LaTeX editors?
faq.answer: This skill provides MathJax syntax optimized for Obsidian. Not all LaTeX commands work the same in MathJax.
